description: The accumulation of genetic damage and mutations in cells over time
citations: López-Otín, C., et al. 'The Hallmarks of Aging.' Cell 153.6 (2013): 1194-1217.

description: The progressive shortening of telomeres, which are protective caps at the ends of chromosomes
citations: López-Otín, C., et al. 'The Hallmarks of Aging.' Cell 153.6 (2013): 1194-1217.
Blackburn, E. H., et al. 'Telomeres and Telomerase: Their Mechanisms of Action and the Effects of Altering Their Functions.' FEBS Letters 249.1 (1989): 17-23.

description: Changes in gene expression patterns and chromatin structure that occur during aging
citations: López-Otín, C., et al. 'The Hallmarks of Aging.' Cell 153.6 (2013): 1194-1217.
Fraga, M. F., et al. 'Epigenetic Differences Arise During the Lifetime of Monozygotic Twins.' Proceedings of the National Academy of Sciences 102.30 (2005): 10604-10609.

description: The impaired ability of cells to maintain proper protein homeostasis, leading to the accumulation of misfolded or damaged proteins
citations: López-Otín, C., et al. 'The Hallmarks of Aging.' Cell 153.6 (2013): 1194-1217.
Morimoto, R. I., et al. 'The Proteostasis Network and Aging.' Molecular & Cellular Proteomics 18.8 (2019): S1-S12.

description: The decline in the cellular process of macroautophagy, which is responsible for the degradation and recycling of damaged proteins and organelles
citations: López-Otín, C., et al. 'The Hallmarks of Aging.' Cell 153.6 (2013): 1194-1217.
Cuervo, A. M., et al. 'Autophagy and Aging: The Importance of Maintaining 'Clean' Cells.' Nature Reviews Molecular Cell Biology 6.1 (2005): 72-82.

description: The dysregulation of nutrient-sensing pathways, such as insulin and mTOR signaling, which play a crucial role in regulating cellular metabolism and growth
citations: López-Otín, C., et al. 'The Hallmarks of Aging.' Cell 153.6 (2013): 1194-1217.
Kenyon, C. J. 'The Plasticity of Aging: Insights from Long-Lived Mutants.' Cell 120.4 (2005): 449-460.

description: The accumulation of damage and dysfunction in mitochondria, which are the cellular organelles responsible for energy production
relatedTheories: Mitochondrial Free Radical Theory of Aging
citations: López-Otín, C., et al. 'The Hallmarks of Aging.' Cell 153.6 (2013): 1194-1217.
Harman, D. 'Aging: A Theory Based on Free Radical and Radiation Chemistry.' Journal of Gerontology 11.3 (1956): 298-300.

description: The irreversible arrest of cell division and the associated secretion of pro-inflammatory factors, which can contribute to tissue dysfunction and aging
citations: López-Otín, C., et al. 'The Hallmarks of Aging.' Cell 153.6 (2013): 1194-1217.
Hayflick, L., et al. 'The Limited In Vitro Lifetime of Human Diploid Cell Strains.' Experimental Cell Research 37.3 (1965): 614-636.

description: The depletion of stem cell reserves and the associated decline in tissue regeneration and repair
citations: López-Otín, C., et al. 'The Hallmarks of Aging.' Cell 153.6 (2013): 1194-1217.
Conboy, I. M., et al. 'Aging, Stem Cells and Tissue Regeneration: Lessons from Muscle.' Cell Cycle 4.3 (2005): 407-410.

description: The dysregulation of intercellular communication, which is crucial for maintaining tissue homeostasis and coordinating cellular responses
citations: López-Otín, C., et al. 'The Hallmarks of Aging.' Cell 153.6 (2013): 1194-1217.
Franceschi, C., et al. 'Inflamm-Aging: An Evolutionary Perspective on Immunosenescence.' Annals of the New York Academy of Sciences 908.1 (2000): 244-254.

description: The persistent low-grade inflammation that occurs with aging, which can contribute to the development of age-related diseases
citations: López-Otín, C., et al. 'The Hallmarks of Aging.' Cell 153.6 (2013): 1194-1217.
Franceschi, C., et al. 'Inflamm-Aging: An Evolutionary Perspective on Immunosenescence.' Annals of the New York Academy of Sciences 908.1 (2000): 244-254.

description: The age-related alterations in the composition and diversity of the microbiome, which can contribute to inflammation and other age-related processes
citations: López-Otín, C., et al. 'The Hallmarks of Aging.' Cell 153.6 (2013): 1194-1217.
Relman, D. A., et al. 'The Human Microbiome and Host Aging.' Nature Microbiology 6.10 (2021): 1220-1232.
